Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and purple-black in section, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and faint traces of at least thirteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394885) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394885)
